glsa.title: BlueZ: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: Insufficient input validation in BlueZ may lead to arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service.

background.p: BlueZ is a set of Bluetooth tools and system daemons for Linux.

description.p: It has been reported that the Bluetooth packet parser does not validate string length fields in SDP packets.

impact.p: A physically proximate attacker using a Bluetooth device with an already established trust relationship could send specially crafted requests, possibly leading to arbitrary code execution or a crash. Exploitation may also be triggered by a local attacker registering a service record via a UNIX socket or D-Bus interface.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
